mobi.inventica.ifinitysdk.managers

Class IFBluetoothManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • mobi.inventica.ifinitysdk.managers.IFBluetoothManager

  • public class IFBluetoothManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class IFBluetoothManager, used for managing beacons.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean outdoors
      The outdoors flag.
      java.lang.String stickyBeacon
      The name of the closest beacon.

    • Field Detail

      • outdoors

        public boolean outdoors
        The outdoors flag. True means user is outside of the building, false means user is inside the building

      • stickyBeacon

        public java.lang.String stickyBeacon
        The name of the closest beacon.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static IFBluetoothManager getInstance()
        Returns the shared instance of IFBluetoothManager.
        Returns:
        shared instance of IFBluetoothManager

      • startManager

        public void startManager(Context context)
                  throws IFNullBluetoothException
        This method starts Low Energy scan in IFBluetoothManager.
        Parameters:
        context - context of the current state of application
        Throws:
        IFNullBluetoothException - if bluetooth module returns null

      • stopManager

        public void stopManager()
        this method stops Low Energy scan in IFBluetoothManager and resets all the transmitters.

      • resetTransmitters

        public void resetTransmitters()
        this method resets all active transmitters

      • setBeaconPosition

        public void setBeaconPosition(java.lang.String deviceName,
                              com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng position)
        this method sets position of the specified beacon
        Parameters:
        deviceName - name of the specified position
        position - the coordinates for beacon's position

      • isBeaconOnline

        public boolean isBeaconOnline(java.lang.String deviceName)
        this method checks if specified beacon is currently transmitting
        Parameters:
        deviceName - name of the device
        Returns:
        true if beacon is transmitting, false if it isn't

      • setOnlyNear

        public void setOnlyNear(boolean onlyNear)
        this method sets a flag to accept only near beacons
        Parameters:
        onlyNear - true if you want to accept only near beacons, false if you want to accept all beacons

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        this method checks if IFBluetoothManager is running
        Returns:
        true if it's running, false if it's not

      • getOnlineCount

        public int getOnlineCount()
        this method returns count of all currently transmitting beacons
        Returns:
        transmittersCount size of the transmitters array

      • getTransmitters

        public java.util.List<IFTransmitter> getTransmitters()
        this method returns list of names of all currently transmitting beacons
        Returns:
        nameList list of the transmitters names

      • getStrongestTransmitter

        public java.lang.String getStrongestTransmitter()
        this method returns name of the strongest device. If there isn't any, it returns empty string
        Returns:
        strongestDeviceName name of the strongest device

      • getDistanceFromBeacon

        public double getDistanceFromBeacon(java.lang.String deviceName)
        this method returns distance from the beacon
        Parameters:
        deviceName - name of the device
        Returns:
        distance returns distance greater than zero if it is currently online, zero if it isn't

      • addOnMonitorBeaconListener

        public void addOnMonitorBeaconListener(java.lang.String deviceName,
                                       OnMonitorBeaconListener listener)
        This method adds new listeners for monitoring every change in beacon's state
        Parameters:
        deviceName - name of monitored beacon
        listener - OnMonitorBeaconListener a callback for every change in beacon's state

      • addOnTransmitterFindListener

        public void addOnTransmitterFindListener(java.lang.String deviceName,
                                         OnTransmitterFindListener listener)
        This method adds new listeners for finding new transmitters. Listeners are invoked only once, after that they are removed
        Parameters:
        deviceName - name of the device
        listener - OnTransmitterFindListener listener
        See Also:
        OnTransmitterFindListener

      • addOnLostTransmitterListener

        public void addOnLostTransmitterListener(java.lang.String deviceName,
                                         OnTransmitterLostListener listener)
        This method adds new listeners for when transmitters goes offline. Listeners are invoked only once, after that they are removed
        Parameters:
        deviceName - name of the device
        listener - OnLostTransmitterListener listener
        See Also:
        OnTransmitterLostListener
